page.title: 10RECREATION IN SWINFORD
page.content: There is a variety of clubs in this area.{Rowland United Cricket Club}and {Rugby Hockey Club}have pitches and a clubhouse which is also used for social functions.The{Women's Institute was founded over 60 years ago. The {Youth Club}has taken over the W.M.C. whilst the{Badminton Club}meets at the village hall. The{Swinford Operatic {and Dramatic Society}puts on two shows each year. The{Friendly Three}is a club for the over sixties from Swinford, Shawell and Catthorpe. The {Mothers' Union}meets at the Vicarage once a month.{Darts}and{Skittles}teams are based at the two public houses in the village. The{Swinford Enhancement {Committee}comprises members of the village who meet to discuss plans for new buildings. There is also a{play {area}situated behind the mud wall on the{village green.}
